intro: Adenia gummifera var. gummifera, commonly known as the gum tree or Adenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. The plant is often found in rocky or coastal areas and is adapted to arid conditions.
